Articles.Content:
Hello, all!

I'm Nintendo (not the company... just a person...). You can call me Nin. Anyways, I've been playing KSP since roughly a month before .23, but I had promised myself a while back that I'd not create a forum account until I made a successful docking. I know, it's a bit late, but today I had my first ever docking. I'm now creating a station (once I did the first docking, I could do it pretty easily for the rest). So... in that sense, my biggest achievement yet is, oddly, creating a space station. But that's not all I've done, it's just what I think is my biggest achievement. I've managed to do most things in the game -- Land a huge rover on both Duna and Eve, have return missions from them, have a base on Laythe, have satellites orbiting every body in the Kerbol system, and have a Voyager-esque craft leaving Kerbol right now.

By no means am I an expert at the game, I mean, I couldn't even dock until today, but... I know how to build good rockets and fly them efficiently.

Anyways, I just wanted to say hi, so, hello!

Cue montage:

Yeah...It's a small montage I deleted my screenshots when I downloaded .25

I look forward to being a true member of this community!

- Nin

Edited November 11, 2014 by Nintendo

Welcome! Glad to have you here on the forum!

This is a shameless plug, but if you're looking for something interesting to do here around the forum, I've just began experimenting with a "community game" of KSP in Career Mode, where community members get input into the next mission objectives (and perhaps even execution, I haven't decided on that yet!)

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/97408-Northstar-s-Collaborative-Kerbal-Career-Campaign

Regards,

Northstar

Oh, thanks!

Just wondering, how do you use spoilers? Can you use them? Thanks in advance.

I'll check out that thread

- Nin

SARUMAN KILLS MUAD'DIB!

Use a '/' instead of a '\':

TEXT[\spoiler]

Yarr!

Edited October 19, 2014 by NFUN

A MASIVE WELCOME TO YOU, NIN!!!!!

i played the game first in late January, but i played the demo for a few months before that

welcome! It looks like you're off to a good start.

~Zekes
